text: James Gottfried Frey (May 26, 1931 – April 12, 2020) was an American manager and coach in Major League Baseball. He led the Kansas City Royals to their first American League championship in 1980. In the World Series, they lost to the Philadelphia Phillies. He also managed the Chicago Cubs. Frey was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He died on April 12, 2020 in Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * Baseball Reference – Major League Managerial Record *SABR Project Biography *Venezuelan League Batting Statistics Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Chicago Cubs managers Category:Kansas City Royals Category:Sportspeople from Cleveland
title: Jim Frey
